result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armani Amir Watkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Armani Amir Watkins not in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Armani Amir Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Attorney Ertl states that defendant is at work and could appear this afternoon. Case is adjourned to 2:30 pm.

***

Recalled at 2:46 PM. Defendant Armani Amir Watkins in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Armani Amir Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Case in court for Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 13.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Armani Amir Watkins not in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Armani Amir Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing and calendar call. Defendant DID NOT appear. Defense informs the court the defendant did not appear due to a personal issue that was placed on the record. Court waived defendant's appearance. STAYED WARRANT TO CONTINUE. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
& ADDENDUM, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.
Defense, filed.
Defense, filed.
Defense, filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel informed the Court that this case is in resolution posture.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing & calendar call in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Armani Amir Watkins in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on defendant's appearance in court, Court cancels stayed bench warrant.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 37.  Calendar call scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Ertl informed the Court he has been appointed as counsel. Court allows the 06/23/2022 indigency hearing to be changed to a status conference at 1:30pm on 06/23/2022.

Defendant Armani Amir Watkins in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is not eligible for a SPD and Court ordered an in-person hearing be set.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with SK and MM. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Armani Amir Watkins in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee , Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/19/22 @ 1:30p
